paragraphs.1: Decides to proclaim 28 January the International Day of Peaceful Coexistence, to be observed annually;
paragraphs.2: Invites all Member States and relevant organizations of the United Nations system, within existing resources, as well as other international and regional organizations and other stakeholders, including civil society, the private sector, academia and the media, to observe the International Day in an appropriate manner;
paragraphs.3: Invites all Member States to further promote a culture of peace to help to ensure peace and sustainable development, including through the celebration of the international, regional and national days in this regard and by mobilizing the efforts of the international community to promote peace, tolerance, inclusion, understanding and solidarity;
paragraphs.4: Stresses that the cost of all activities that may arise from the implementation of the present resolution should be met from voluntary contributions;
paragraphs.5: Requests the Secretary-General to bring the present resolution to the attention of all Member States, the organizations of the United Nations system and civil society organizations for appropriate observance.
